descriptionProfile: We are Your Shot—National Geographic's photo community. Let's tell stories together. #YourShotPhotographer
We are Your Shot—National Geographic's photo community. Let's tell stories together.

posts.description:
Catch of the Day | Photograph by Marek Jackowski (@marek_jackowski)
.
A Dalmatian pelican catches a fish thrown by a fisherman at Kerkini Lake, Greece. During the winter, the fishermen "feed pelicans and help them to survive" says Your Shot photographer Marek Jackowski.
--
Today we’re featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo March’s “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

124 Floors High | Photograph by Teovel Iradon (@iradonteovel)
.
A window cleaner stops at the 124th floor of the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, the highest building in the world.
--
Today we’re featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo March’s “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Great Migration | Photograph by Dinesh Naduvil
.
Known as one of the great migrations of wildlife, wildebeest cross the Mara river in Maasai Mara, Kenya.
--
Today we’re featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo March’s “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Perfectly Posed | Photograph by Rita Kluge (@kluge_photo)
.
Your Shot photographer Rita Kluge encountered this humpback whale while snorkeling in Tonga. She said this is "one of the locations where they are born and nursed before heading with their mum to their new home in Antartica." The whale swam right up to her and posed just long enough for her to get the photo.
--
Today we’re featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo March’s “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Diamond Beach | Photograph by Yiannis Pavlis
.
Among his gallery of show-stopping photos from Iceland, Your Shot photographer Yiannis Pavlis captured this long exposure image of Diamond Beach in Iceland. The icebergs from the Jökulsárlón lagoon are polished by the waters of the Atlantic Ocean and resemble diamonds.
--
Today we’re featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo March’s “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Petal Portrait | Photograph by Joe Bürgi (@joebuergi.photography)
.
Your Shot photographer Joe Bürgi took a tour of the remote Omo Valley in southern Ethiopia. This boy posed for him, a member of one of the tribes that lives in the region.
--
Today we’re featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo March’s “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

[ #MyClimateAction ]
Clean the Ganges | Photograph by #YourShotPhotographer Sirsendu Gayen
.
In the holy city of Varanasi, India, two men clean devotees’ offerings from the Ganges, which Hindus regard as their most sacred river. Supporting over 400 million people on its course from glacial mountains to the Bay of Bengal, the Ganges is also one of the most polluted rivers in the world.
--
Join @natgeo in our The People vs. Climate Change initiative and use #MyClimateAction to share photos and stories on how we as humans are taking positive steps to protect the Earth.

Tokyo from 23-05 | Photograph by Dean Cobin
.
“Sometimes you go looking for a shot and sometimes a shot finds you. Having traveled to Tokyo many times I specifically went to the Shibuya Station area to shoot the famous crossing,” writes Your Shot photographer Dean Cobin. “When I got to my hotel room 23 floors above the city, I was greeted by this wonderful view of the city from my window. When night fell I set up my tripod, put on a title shift lens for perspective control, and got my best shots without ever leaving the room. I envisioned this is as a black and white shot from the start.”
--
“Tokyo is a city that ranks at the top of my travel wish list. The buildings and architecture always seem like they were designed with a future aesthetic. You were right in thinking that this would make a great black and white image. I love the added details of billboards and the street lights.” — @natgeoyourshot associate photo editor Matt Adams (@themattadams). This photo was submitted our “Cities in Black and White” assignment, curated by Matt Adams. He is inviting you to share images of everything that makes a city interesting — but in black and white. To submit your photos, go to the link in our profile. #YourShotPhotographer

Top Shot: Rolling Hills | Photograph by Thomas Zsebok
.
Your Shot photographer Thomas Zsebok composed this minimalist image of the Tuscany countryside during the mid-afternoon. Tuscany is a region in central Italy and is regarded as the birthplace of the Italian Renaissance. It's an area also known for its picturesque landscapes and rolling green hills. --
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account. #YourShotPhotographer

Life is Short | Photograph by Craig Calvert (@craigcalvert)
.
“Life is short,” writes Your Shot photographer Craig Calvert, “so you might as well have some fun.”
--
“Fantastic! What makes this frame for me is your caption: “Life is short — so you might as well have some fun.” As I look at your photo, I imagine the individual jumping is thinking exactly this, while his friends watch. Life is about taking a leap of faith, about trying something new. Because by the time you have regret, it might be too late…” — 
@natgeoyourshot associate photo editor David Y. Lee (@davidylee) #YourShotPhotographer

Happy Hour at the Banzai Pipeline | Photograph by Todd Wass (@fotoddgraphes)
.
“Three-time bodyboarding world champion Jeff Hubbard (@jdhubb) launches huge air at the pipeline on the famed north shore of Oahu,” writes Your Shot photographer Todd Wass. “I set out to capture a shot that portrayed the feeling of enjoying a beautiful hot afternoon on the beach at the pipeline while enjoying an icy cold beer. I got lucky as Jeff boosted huge air over Nanae as she stood watching.”
--
“I see a nice mix of bodyboarding and surfing images on Your Shot. This photograph really stood out to me thanks to how it was composed — having Nanae in the foreground of this image takes it to another level. You wrote in your caption that you set out to portray ‘the feeling of enjoying a beautiful hot afternoon at the beach,’ and I believe you accomplished that goal with this image.” — @natgeoyourshot associate photo editor Matt Adams (@themattadams) #YourShotPhotographer

Top Shot: Split Manta | Photograph by Ryan Williams (@ryzphoto)
.
Your Shot photographer Ryan Williams captured this image of a scarred manta ray off the coast of Nusa Penida an island located in Indonesia. In January 2014, @conservationorg and the @wildaid organization were able to secure full national protection for manta rays and established Indonesia as the world’s largest manta sanctuary. Manta rays are better protected now, but are still being hunted and sold to fish markets.
--
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account. #YourShotPhotographer

Working at Night | Photograph by Nguyen Thanh Duong (@chencocot)
.
“In the landfill of Nha Trang City at night,” writes Your Shot photographer Nguyen Thanh Duong, “almost everybody working here are older people and children.”
--
“This image is great! The mood here is dark and matches the landscape perfectly. You were really able to capture a mood here within this image and I love how the lights are falling on the subjects walking through the landfill. This has the look of a film still and it made me stop during my edit because I knew I had to view this large on my monitor. Great work.” — @natgeoyourshot associate photo editor Matt Adams (@themattadams) #YourShotPhotographer

Felicidade | Photograph by Kicia Randagia
.
“This photo is part of my long term ongoing project ‘Felicidade,’” writes Your Shot photographer Kicia Randagia. “My research is about the importance for children to be in contact with nature and animals.”
--
“An excellent moment captured here. The child has such a great expression on her face, it’s a look of happiness as she rests against the horse. The tones here are so nice, even though it’s a digital photo, it feels like it was shot on medium format film. That’s just how rich the tones look. Great work composing this image; it’s a great series.” — @natgeoyourshot associate photo editor Matt Adams (@themattadams) #YourShotPhotographer

Top Shot: Hearts in the Sky | Photograph by Charleton Churchill (@charletonchurchill)
.
Your Shot photographer Charleton Churchill captured this landscape image in the western region of Nepal, near Mount Everest. He was preparing to photograph his two friends, James and Ashley, who were getting married that day. “We were on our way to Everest Base Camp in March 2017 to have James and Ashley get married and be the first to do it in a wedding dress and tuxedo," writes Churchill. "On the way to base camp that morning, I took a photograph of this beautiful landscape and when I went through my images, I saw two hearts in the sky, like a puzzle, where the two hearts became one.”
--
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account. #YourShotPhotographer

Winter Boredom | Photograph by Angee Manns (@2bseenphotography)
.
“My son being incredibly bored inside during these cold winter days,” writes Your Shot photographer Angee Manns.
--
“I love how this frame feels like you’ve paused a moment in time Angee. I can feel how incredibly bored your son is. Keep documenting intimate and every day moments like this — you will have a beautiful portfolio of your family growing up over the years that will be cherished for generations.” — @natgeoyourshot associate photo editor David Y. Lee (@davidylee) #YourShotPhotographer

The Adopted | Photograph by Khant Zaw
.
Young boy with his little infant monkey at the Pho Kyar Elephant Camp in Myanmar. “It’s mother was killed by hunters,” reveals Your Shot photographer Khant Zaw.
--
“This is very touching and my daughter’s favorite image. The expression on the monkey and the comfort this infant needs from the close contact is visible here. Hunting the mom, leaving the infants is horrid and mentally scarring.” — Fine art/editorial photographer Robin Schwartz (@robin_schwartz) #YourShotPhotographer
